questiontext.text: Suppose there are two players playing with four pure dice. They must take turns rolling these four dice at the same time. Player A gets a point if no 3 is rolled and player B gets a point if at least one of the four dice has one 3 on top. Is this a fair game for both players according to probability theory?

answer.text: Yes, because both players have the same probability.
